title: Installation issue: readline doesn't link to ncurses
body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

```console
$ spack install readline
```

### Information on your system

* **Spack:** 0.14.2-1394-3609f36e6
* **Python:** 3.8.2
* **Platform:** linux-ubuntu20.04-skylake (via WSL)

### Additional information

The installation succeeds just fine, and there are no errors in any logs, but the resulting readline libraries don't link to ncurses:
```console
$ ldd -r lib/libreadline.so
        linux-vdso.so.1 (0x00007fffc89c4000)
        libc.so.6 => /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6 (0x00007fccb0930000)
        /lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2 (0x00007fccb0b85000)
undefined symbol: UP    (lib/libreadline.so)
undefined symbol: PC    (lib/libreadline.so)
undefined symbol: BC    (lib/libreadline.so)
undefined symbol: tputs (lib/libreadline.so)
undefined symbol: tgoto (lib/libreadline.so)
undefined symbol: tgetflag      (lib/libreadline.so)
undefined symbol: tgetent       (lib/libreadline.so)
undefined symbol: tgetnum       (lib/libreadline.so)
undefined symbol: tgetstr       (lib/libreadline.so)
```
From what I can tell, these symbols are supposed to be provided by ncurses. I tried modifying the package to explicitly RPATH things:
```diff
diff --git a/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/readline/package.py b/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/readline/package.py
index 7a15595fa..4731ea96c 100644
--- a/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/readline/package.py
+++ b/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/readline/package.py
@@ -29,7 +29,10 @@ class Readline(AutotoolsPackage, GNUMirrorPackage):

     def build(self, spec, prefix):
         options = [
-            'SHLIB_LIBS=-L{0} -lncursesw'.format(spec['ncurses'].prefix.lib)
+            'SHLIB_LIBS=-L{0} {1}{0} -lncursesw'.format(
+                spec['ncurses'].prefix.lib,
+                self.compiler.cc_rpath_arg,
+            )
         ]

         make(*options)
```
but that didn't help. Because of this, my Python installation doesn't work properly with arrow keys.
